faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course introduces the fundamentals, models, and applications of game theory. The focus is primarily on static models with complete information, with optional introductions to dynamic and incomplete information models.
description.et: Kursus tutvustab mänguteooria põhiolemust, mudeleid ja rakendamisvõimalusi. Peamiselt on vaatluse all staatilised täieliku infoga mudelid, valikuliselt tutvutakse ka dünaamiliste ja mittetäieliku infoga mudelitega.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to explain the concepts and models of game theory and their applications in the real economy.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on selgitada mänguteooria kontseptsioone ja mudeleid ning nende rakendusi reaalses majanduses.

learning_outcomes.en: After passing the course the student:
·	Is able to find the Nash equilibrium
·	Is able to find optimal solution using backwards induction
·	Knows the basics of mixed, correlated and evolutionary equilibrium
learning_outcomes.et: Tunneb klassikalise ja evolutsioonilise mänguteooria tasakaalupunktide erisusi

learning_outcomes.en: ·	Is able to analyze the situation with the uncertainty and risk
learning_outcomes.et: Oskab analüüsida otsustusolukordi määramatuse ja riski tingimustes

learning_outcomes.en: Can give real-life examples of game-theoretic situations.
learning_outcomes.et: Oskab tuua reaalsest elust näiteid mänguteoreetiliste olukordade kohta.

independent_work.en: Instructions for individual assignments will be given at the beginning of the course in Moodle.
independent_work.et: Instructions for individual assignments will be given at the beginning of the course in Moodle.

description.en: To pass the course, the student must attend at least 70% of the classes (10% of the final grade)
description.et: To pass the course, student must attend at least 70% of the classes (10% of the final grade)

grade_preconditions.en: The final grade is the weighted sum of the results of all assessed activities.
grade_preconditions.et: The final grade is the weighted sum of the results of all assessed activities.

grade_evaluation.en: The points will be converted to the grades as follows: 1) score 91-100: A; 2) 81-90: B:, 3) 71-80: C; 4) 61-70: D; 5) 51-60: E; 6) Less than 51% - F (failed)
